content: Judgment Must Come

Then the LORD said to me, “Even though Moses and Samuel were to stand before Me [interceding for them], My heart would still not be [turned with favor] toward this people [Judah]. Send them away from My presence  out of My sight and let them go!
And it shall be that when they say to you, ‘Where should we go?’ then tell them, ‘Thus says the LORD:
I will appoint four kinds of destroyers over them,” says the LORD, “the sword to slay, the dogs to tear  drag away, and the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth to devour and to destroy.
I will make them an object of horror to all nations of the earth because of Manasseh [the despicable] son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, for the [evil and detestable] things which he did in Jerusalem.
Jeremiah’s Prayer and God’s Answer
O , You know  understand;
Remember me [thoughtfully], take notice of me,
take vengeance for me on my persecutors.
Do not, in view of Your patience, take me away;
Know that for Your sake I endure [continual] rebuke  dishonor.
Your words were found and I ate them,
And Your words became a joy to me and the delight of my heart;
For I have been called by Your name,
O  God of hosts.
I did not sit with the group of those who celebrate,
Nor did I rejoice;
I sat alone because Your [powerful] hand was ,
For You had filled me with indignation [at their sin].
Why has my pain been perpetual
And my wound incurable, refusing to be healed?
Will you indeed be to me like a deceptive
With water that is unreliable?
